How to Install editmoin on debian

  • Home
  • debian
  • editmoin

Today in this tutorial, I’ll show you how you can install editmoin on debian with and without using the command line.

Introduction

Installing editmoin on debian is very easy. And with the help of this tutorial, you will be able to easily install, update and uninstall editmoin in just a few steps.

In this tutorial I’ll show you four methods to install editmoin, the methods are using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic. All these methods require you to have an active and stable internet connection and sudo permission.

Install editmoin Using apt

To install editmoin in debian using apt, you will need to run the apt update command first to get the updated list of packages from the repositories.

Copy the command given below and paste it in the command line, then press enter. If you are using the sudo command for the first time then you might also need to enter your root password.

sudo apt update

After you have updated the package list using apt, you can now install editmoin using the apt install command. To do that use the command given below.

sudo apt -y install editmoin

The installation of editmoin might take a little bit of time depending upon your internet connection and machine configuration.

Install editmoin Using apt-get

To install editmoin using apt-get in debian, you will need to first update the package list using the apt-get update command. Copy, paste, and enter the command given below in the command line.

sudo apt-get update

After updating the package lists, use the apt-get install command given below to install editmoin.

sudo apt-get -y install editmoin

Install editmoin Using Synaptic

To install editmoin using Synaptic you will need to first install Synaptic, you can do that by following the instructions from here. After installing synaptic follow the steps below to install editmoin on your debian using Synaptic.

You can open synaptic by clicking on the menu icon then searching for synaptic or you can open the command line and enter the command given below –

sudo synaptic

After synaptic opens, click on the search icon and search for editmoin. This will display the editmoin package in the package window, now to install editmoin, click on the checkbox that is on the left side.

Then click on Mark for Installation, this will select the editmoin package for installation, now to install it click on the Apply button, you will get a summary window where click on the apply button again to start the download of editmoin.

If the download and installation are successful then the checkmark option will turn green.

Install editmoin Using aptitude

To install editmoin on debian using aptitude, you will need to first install Aptitude in your debian. To install Aptitude follow the instructions here. Once you have aptitude installed proceed to the installation of editmoin.

Now you will need to first update your package lists from the repositories, use the apt update command for that, after that update the package list of aptitude using the aptitude update command.

sudo apt update sudo aptitude update

After updating the package list of aptitude, install editmoin using the command aptitude install editmoin.

sudo aptitude -y install editmoin

How to Upgrade editmoin on debian

If you want to upgrade the editmoin package on your debian to its latest version then here’s how you can do that using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic.

Upgrade editmoin using Apt & Apt-get

To upgrade editmoin to its latest version using apt or apt-get, you will need to open the terminal then run the sudo apt update command to update the package list, after that copy and paste the commands given below to upgrade editmoin.

sudo apt install --only-upgrade editmoin sudo apt-get install --only-upgrade editmoin

Upgrade editmoin using Aptitude

To upgrade editmoin using aptitude you will need to again run the update command to update the package list, use command sudo aptitude update to do that. After that run the command given below to upgrade editmoin.

sudo aptitude -y full-upgrade editmoin

Upgrade editmoin using Synaptic

To upgrade editmoin using synaptic open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or by going to the menu and searching for synaptic.

In synaptic click on the reload button, this will look for updates. After that you will need to search for editmoin, now right-click editmoin, and click on the mark for upgrade option.

Now to upgrade editmoin just click on the apply button, then click on the apply button again in the summary screen.

How To Uninstall editmoin on debian

If you want to remove and uninstall editmoin from your debian then here’s how you can do that. To remove just editmoin, you can use the command that is given below, copy the command, paste it in the command line then press enter.

sudo apt remove editmoin

Remove related packages, dependencies & configuration files of editmoin

To remove all the related packages, dependencies and configuration files of editmoin you can use the command given below.

sudo apt -y purge editmoin

Remove editmoin using Synaptic Package Manager

You can also uninstall editmoin using the synaptic package manager, first open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or search and open it directly.

After that in synaptic search for editmoin, right-click the editmoin package and click on the Mark for Complete Removal option. Now to uninstall editmoin click on the apply button then in summary click on apply again.

Conclusion

That is how you can install editmoin on debian using the command line or using the synaptic package manager. I also showed you how you can uninstall and upgrade editmoin using the command line or using the synaptic package manager.

If you need any help regarding the installation of editmoin then send me a mail at netmikoblog@gmail.com, thank you.
